wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Hodgson(1795–1854) was an English  politician who represented Barnstaple from 1824 to 1830; 1831 to 1832; and 1837 to 1847.

response: In 1843, it was residence to the politician Frederick Hodgson, MP for Barnstable. In 1856 it was the home of the Conservative MP for Buteshire, James Stuart-Wortley. The house was the residence of the Conservative politician and army officer George Weld-Forester, 3rd Baron Forester in the 1870s; Weld-Forester died at the property in 1886.
